title: Cognitive Load Simulator
description: An interactive MicroSim for experimenting with instructional design choices and visualizing their impact on intrinsic, extraneous, and germane cognitive load based on Cognitive Load Theory.
creator: Claude AI
subject: Cognitive Load Theory
Instructional Design
Educational Psychology
Learning Sciences
Working Memory
audience: Educators, instructional designers, and students learning about cognitive load theory and its applications
source: Based on Cognitive Load Theory (Sweller, 1988) and multimedia learning principles (Mayer, 2009)
relation: Part of Automating Instructional Design intelligent textbook
coverage: Instructional design principles for managing cognitive load
learningObjective: Allow learners to experiment with different instructional design choices and see their impact on the three types of cognitive load, developing intuition for design tradeoffs

interactivity.inputMethod: Mouse click, slider drag, dropdown selection

visualElements.loadBars: Horizontal bar meters for three load types plus total

learningObjectives: Understand the key concepts of cognitive load simulator
Explore cognitive load simulator through interactive visualization
Apply knowledge of cognitive load simulator to solve problems
Experiment with parameters to observe their effects on cognitive load simulator
